intro: Lomatogonium rotatum f. albiflorum, commonly known as the whiteflower lomatogonium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and yellow to white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while the inflorescence consists of small, clustered flowers. This variety is distinguished by its pale flowers, which contrast with the darker blooms of the typical form.
